definition: blue-and-green landscape (genre of landscape painting originating in the Tang dynasty, in which blues and greens predominate)
abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
accurate depiction of architectural forms with the aid of a ruler (technique of Chinese art)/picture created using this technique
freehand drawing or painting in traditional Chinese style
gongbi, traditional Chinese painting method characterized by meticulous brush technique and detailed description
Shi Tao (1642-1707), Chinese landscape painter and poet
Wang Ximeng (c. 1096-c. 1119), Song artist, probably teenage prodigy who died young, painter of Thousand Miles of Landscape 千里江山
Huang Binhong (1865-1955), art historian and literati painter
Chang Dai-chien or Zhang Daqian (1899-1983), one of the greatest Chinese artists of the 20th century
